materials.raw_text: Cs: 1.5 g, Ga: 3 g, K: 12 g, Na: 7 g, Sb: 8 g

sourcing.instructions: Cs: Purchase from a chemical supply company; Ga: Obtain from a metals supplier; K: Source from a chemical reagent supplier; Na: Acquire from a chemical supply store; Sb: Purchase from a metal supply vendor.
steps: Cs: Purchase from a chemical supply company; Ga: Obtain from a metals supplier; K: Source from a chemical reagent supplier; Na: Acquire from a chemical supply store; Sb: Purchase from a metal supply vendor.

1. Weigh out 1.5 g of Cesium (Cs), 3 g of Gallium (Ga), 12 g of Potassium (K), 7 g of Sodium (Na), and 8 g of Antimony (Sb) using an analytical balance. 2. Combine all ingredients in a clean, dry ceramic crucible. 3. Use a pestle and mortar to grind the mixture into a fine powder to ensure homogeneity. 4. Transfer the ground mixture back into the crucible.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 1.5 g of Cesium (Cs), 3 g of Gallium (Ga), 12 g of Potassium (K), 7 g of Sodium (Na), and 8 g of Antimony (Sb) using an analytical balance. 2. Combine all ingredients in a clean, dry ceramic crucible. 3. Use a pestle and mortar to grind the mixture into a fine powder to ensure homogeneity. 4. Transfer the ground mixture back into the crucible.

steps: 1. Place the crucible in a furnace. 2. Heat the mixture gradually to 500째C at a rate of 10째C/min. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow for complete reaction and formation of the compound.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the crucible in a furnace. 2. Heat the mixture gradually to 500째C at a rate of 10째C/min. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow for complete reaction and formation of the compound.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally, which should take approximately 3 hours. 2. Ensure that the cooling process occurs in a well-ventilated area to avoid exposure to any fumes.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally, which should take approximately 3 hours. 2. Ensure that the cooling process occurs in a well-ventilated area to avoid exposure to any fumes.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough edges and achieve the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant if the material requires protection from moisture or environmental factors.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough edges and achieve the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant if the material requires protection from moisture or environmental factors.
